reporting-org.narrative: The federal government of the United States

title.narrative: U.S.-Africa Energy Sector Standards Cooperation Program

description.narrative: Support the creation, improvement and sustainability of physical infrastructure, and related services, in both urban and rural areas, to enhance the economic environment and improve economic productivity, including for women. The main infrastructures include energy, including electric power transmission lines and distribution networks, oil/gas terminals, refineries, storage facilities and pipelines; telecom and ICT; and transport, including roads, airports, railways, and ports.

This award supports the creation, improvement and sustainability of physical infrastructure, and related services, in both urban and rural areas, to enhance the economic environment and improve economic productivity, including for women,. More specifically, this award includes a USTDA funding is supporting the U.S.-Africa Energy Sector Standards Cooperation Program (Technical Assistance or TA). The TA is designed to share important U.S. commercial and industrial standards information and practices with government officials and industry in sub-Saharan African countries to ensure that decision makers who develop and implement standards, testing protocols and regulatory procedures for the energy sector are informed of internationally accepted industry-led standards. The TA maximizes cost-sharing by U.S. industry and strongly features U.S. private sector technology, expertise, best practices and resources to carry out standards workshops in sub-Saharan Africa. USTDA funding of $511,070 is supporting five additional workshops under the U.S.-Africa Energy Sector Standards Cooperation Program ('CESP'). The CESP is designed to share important U.S. commercial and industrial standards and practices with government officials and industry in Sub-Saharan African countries to ensure that decision makers who develop and implement standards, testing protocols and regulatory procedures for the energy sector are informed of internationally accepted industry-led standards. The CESP maximizes cost-sharing by U.S. industry and strongly features U.S. private sector technology, expertise, best practices and resources to carry out standards workshops in Sub-Saharan Africa. USTDA funding of $429,919 is supporting four additional workshops under the U.S.-Africa Energy Sector Standards Cooperation Program ('CESP'). The CESP is designed to share important U.S. commercial and industrial standards and practices with government officials and industry in Sub-Saharan African countries to ensure that decision makers who develop and implement standards, testing protocols and regulatory procedures for the energy sector are informed of internationally accepted industry-led standards. The CESP maximizes cost-sharing by U.S. industry and strongly features U.S. private sector technology, expertise, best practices and resources to carry out standards workshops in Sub-Saharan Africa..
